TopicTitle: Anybody here have android app concepts?

Articles.Content:
Well after a month I have learned 80% of android variables, and can\'t think of app concepts.

Anyone have concepts?

(Of course the app is free and won\'t be advertised on the forums...)

I probably won\'t get it out to the play store, since I don\'t have $25.00 to spend on that.

I probably will get it out on other famous markets, and I will host it on a site.

Are there any programs that graphically map the accelerometer data?

That\'s always cool to play with. And could make a nice back-end for future apps.

> 
> Are there any programs that graphically map the accelerometer data?
> 
> -snip-

You gave me an idea! He can make a seismometer!

You would have to sign a non-discloser agreement and be a good programmer for me to tell you my money making ideas ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Most good apps are calculators for different jobs. Unit conversions, ballistic, and navigational calculations ect.
I know there are plenty of sound meters but you could try

> 
> Well after a month I have learned 80% of android variables, and can\'t think of app concepts.
> Anyone have concepts?

Mechjeb!

Not the autopilot so much as the info, most of the time I have so many info windows open that I the view is less than idea. Delta V stats, orbit info, aerodynamics all of that. Would be great to have that on my tablet so I can bask in the full glory of my rockets unimpeded by semi-transparent windows.

> 
> Well after a month I have learned 80% of android variables, and can\'t think of app concepts.
> Anyone have concepts?
> 
> (Of course the app is free and won\'t be advertised on the forums...)
> 
> I probably won\'t get it out to the play store, since I don\'t have $25.00 to spend on that.
> 
> I probably will get it out on other famous markets, and I will host it on a site.

An interplanetary transfer calculator (like the one you can find on the web, but on a phone it would allow me to stop using ALT-TAB while playing).

Would be good to add a KSP Dv map, too (my other use of ALT-TAB while in game).
Awsome! A unofficial KSP app! I always have my nexus 7 next to me to use the various calculators available on various websites
